titles.title: Fair Labor Standards Amendments of 1995
To amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to increase the minimum wage.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Workforce Protections.

committee.name: House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities

bill.summary: 1/31/1995--Introduced. Fair Labor Standards Amendments of 1995 - Amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to increase the minimum wage to: (1) $4.25 an hour during the period ending six months after the date of enactment of this Act; (2) $4.50 an hour during the succeeding year; (3) $4.75 during the succeeding year; (4) $5.00 during the succeeding year; and (5) $5.25 thereafter.
